recipes.title: Makeover Peach Bowl Pizza

winePairing.pairingText: Pizza works really well with Sangiovese, Barbera Wine, and Shiraz. The best wine for pizza depends on the toppings! Red sauce pizza will call for a red wine with some acidity, such as a barberan or sangiovese. Add pepperoni or sausage and you can go bolder with a syrah. One wine you could try is Ricasoli Brolio Chianti Classico Riserva. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 27 dollars.

productMatches.title: Ricasoli Brolio Chianti Classico Riserva
productMatches.description: Intense ruby red color. Clear notes of strawberries, raspberries, spice and vanilla stand out on the nose. The wine is soft and enfolding on the palate; the right balance between acidity and tannins leaves a pleasant and persistent aftertaste in the mouth.Blend: 80% Sangiovese, 15% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon.

recipes.instructions: Directions                                                                                In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar and salt. Cut in butter until crumbly. Press onto an ungreased 12-in. pizza pan. Bake at 350° for 15-18 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack.                                                                                           In a small bowl, beat the cream cheese, confectioners' sugar and extract until smooth; fold in whipped topping. Spread over crust. Arrange the peaches on top. Refrigerate leftovers.                                        Yield: 16 slices.                                                                                                                         Originally published as Makeover Peach Bowl Pizza in  Healthy CookingJune/July 2009, p29                                                                                                                                                                                                        Nutritional Facts                                                                             1 slice equals 180 calories, 10 g fat (7 g saturated fat), 27 mg cholesterol, 142 mg sodium, 20 g carbohydrate, 1 g fiber, 3 g protein.                                                                                                                                                                     Print                                                                                    Add to Recipe Box                            Email a Friend

steps.step: In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar and salt.
Cut in butter until crumbly. Press onto an ungreased 12-in. pizza pan.
Bake at 350° for 15-18 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on a wire rack.
In a small bowl, beat the cream cheese, confectioners' sugar and extract until smooth; fold in whipped topping.
Spread over crust. Arrange the peaches on top. Refrigerate leftovers.
